review_blob: On draft from the brewery. Carmel roasted malts that goes down fairly smooth. Its okay but could have been better.

Pint can. Very surprised by this one. Poured clear with a big head at first but quickly settled. I did not get much aroma but think my allergies were causing me some stuffiness. Tasted reminds me of a high octane Sierra Nevada Pale Ale. Overall, it was very good and would recommend trying it.
Pitch black dark with bright white Frothy head. Tastes lighter than it looks. Piney citrus taste with more citrus to it. Good effort in the black ale/IPA category and one of their better efforts.

Poured hazy from 12oz bottle, which I might add is there second week of bottling. Nice quarter in white head. A hoppy beer but I would describe it as almost a creamy hoppiness that coats youre mouth lingers for a couple seconds then disappears. Overall a pretty good Wisconsin IPA which can be hard to come by in this state.

Picked up at Woodmans in Madison WI. Aroma of bread, resin and decaying wet wood. Amber orange haziness in color with a white head. The taste comes off as medium sweet and slightly hoppy with a creamy after taste. Overall, a surprisingly good IPA from a Wisconsin brewery.

From 12 oz bottle from the beer camp pack. Pours clear caramel brown/yellow. Aroma of some pine, citrus. The hops have a floral and grassy aroma. The taste is a light sweet and bitter but with a creaminess that layers your tongue. The carbonation is light and finishes off with a long lingering creamy bitterness. Overall, a really good effort collaboration.
beer_name: Sierra Nevada / Ballast Point Beer Camp Electric Ray

review_blob: 12oz bottle. Not much head on the pour but seems like it had a lot of carbonation. Color of wheat gold. Caramel hop aroma. Mild bitterness that hits the palate just right. Flavor seems to fall apart at the very end but overall a good beer.
beer_name: Sierra Nevada / New Glarus Beer Camp There And Back

review_blob: From 12oz bottle. Pours a golden haze with aroma of green hops. Seems to be really bitter at first then mellows out in the middle and then gives a hop burn down the back end. Good effort from New Glarus but doesnt quite reach the top with against the other double Ipas.
beer_name: New Glarus Thumbprint Series Scream IIPA

review_blob: On draft at vintage. Aroma of citra hops and rye. Front end you get a slight hop flavor with done carbonation. Back end has a dry bitterness that is tart without being sour. OK brew but not something I would try again.

On draft at Dexters in madison Wisconsin. Citra wheaty smell. Hazy golden color. Weak tasting hops and the three overall taste comes out as very unbalanced. The aftertaste is not something to be desired. Would not buy this one glad I just had a pint.
From bottle pours hoppy gold. Taste some real citrus hops but not too bitter and really goes down smoothly. Very satisfying double ipa.

From 12oz bottle. Pours a amber reddish brown with a white head. Aroma of earthy floral hops. Tastes of light sweetness and light bitterness. A light fizzy medium body with a slight bitterness that finishes with a slight creaminess.Overall a pretty good effort and fairly smooth for this high of abv. Good effort for a belgium ipa style.

From 12 oz bottle but have had it on draft also. Aroma of burnt citrus orange. White head and pour a dark orange. Has citrus spruce mixed with orange taste. Hits the palate with a heavy bitterness at the front end and carries toward the back of your mouth with some resin. Very good effort for a Wisconsin Ipa in which this area is not known for imperial Ipas.
beer_name: Tyranena BGW Hop Whore Imperial India Pale Ale

review_blob: On draft at Vintage Brewing. Pours dark black. Not much aromatic anything its roasted yeasty malt. Taste more of dark malt than hops. Ok. Will not be pursuing this again.
On draft at Vintage Brewing. Aroma of resin, roasted malts. Pours like 10/30 oil. Taste like burnt bitter hops mixed with roasted malts. Bit of citrus giving it a smooth palate.
On draft at the Freehouse Pub on Middleton. Pours a muddy brown. Aroma of faint hops, nuts. Chewy taste of bitterness and floral dankness.
beer_name: Karben4 / Summit MACCC Daddy Hophead Red Ale

review_blob: On draft golden color yeasty lemon aroma. Tastes like a citrus pilsner. Light and refreshing.
Bomber. Nice head. Aroma of caramelized malts and underlayed with hops. Silky smooth taste. Licorice and bitterness blended smoothly. One of the better Bipa.
On draft. Floral hoppy nose. Very forward with the citrus hops that mellow out with the alcohol so that it finishes nicely. Very good!
On draft at Dexters. Session style that is very light and smooth ipa especially if drinking in warm weather.
beer_name: Lakefront Extended Play India Session Ale

review_blob: On draft at Vintage. Smell the rye. Nice dark appearance. Taste the rye in all portions of the mouth but come out silky smooth despite the 10.5%.
beer_name: Vintage Rye Whiskey Barrel-Aged Max Stout

review_blob: On draft at the Tipsy Cow. Very creamy imperial black IPA that is very smooth. Starts off with a big creamy head but diminished quickly. Black licorice and hope that is not to over powering. Definitely a winner.
On draft at the Tipsy Cow. Luxurious creamy imperial ipa! Well balanced with the hops and bitterness. Would buy this anytime.
On draft at the Great Dane in Madison. Clear appearance, clean taste not much more. Nice beer for a hot day but there is better pilsners
On draft at the old fashioned. Citra hop nose, clear golden appearance. Comes in clean and finishes with a metallic bitterness. Good for one drink only world not buy a sixer.
Draft pour. Very mild hoppy citrus smell. Semi cloudy with small white head. Slight lemon taste at the beginning and turns slightly bitter on the backside. Overall smooth mid range ipa.
On draft at Vintage. Pours really dark with small dark creamy head. Hints of oatmeal and unsweetened chocolate. Smooth clean finish but lacking the true oatmeal stout punch.
On draft at Vintage and first pour out of the barrel. Tasting a little flat and not much flavor on the front end. Has a mild nutty palate.

Bottled bomber pours light caramel darkness with nice head. Initial taste i got was definitely a rye mixed lightly with the dunkelweizen. Not a bad beer in was expecting more body but was a nice light beer.
beer_name: Captured by Porches Miskatonic Dark Rye

review_blob: Nice and pleasant IPA. From bomber,  poured hazy gold and small head.  Not much of an aroma. Very hop forward but not over powering like a lot of IPAs now a days. Goes down nice,  smooth and refreshing. Gently surprised by this one and it furthers cements San Diegos place in the craft beer world.

Bottle 1897/2000. smell of bourbon and sweet malts. pours a reddish brown with a light head. nice bourbon finish on the back mixed with nice balance of malts. at 10% the alcohol doesnt overpower your tasted buds but you definitely taste the bourbon. Nice find on our trip to portland.
Had on tap. Smooth ipa. Balanced without overpowering you with the hops. My first tasting of Russian river

A smooth well balanced IPA. Hints of floral and pine. Nice amber color. It has a nice citrus and hop flavor to the taste the strike the right balance. The hops dont overwhelm the taste of the beer or make your mouth become dried out. I can drink this beer year round and hope New Glarus decides to make this a year round release.
From 12oz bottle poured into pint glass. Light coffee color with small head. Aroma of roast and oatmeal. Has a slight sweet taste mixed with oatmeal and coffee beans.
A nice balance of vanilla and cocoa. Goes down smooth with a lot of taste and just a slight bitterness that does not take away from the flavors.
Bottle. Red in color and white head. Aroma is cereal grain and toasted malts. Taste of roasted bitter malts that become more bitter toward the back of the palate.

A slightly hoppy wheat beer that pours golden. Has a nice hop to it with wheat and is an easy drinking beer. Finishes clean and crisp. It could do with a little more character but seems fine for an everyday drinking beer.I was only able to find it in a variety pack but that was okay since it came with some of their better tasting IPAs.

16 oz pint bottle. Pours a very dark chocolate color with a medium dark head. Smells of roasted coffee. Tastes mostly like a deep roasted coffee that lightens a bit in the back back of the palate. Very refreshing for a coffee stout.

I have had this on draft and in bomber  bottle pored into a pint glass. I got a hint of burnt roasted coffee on the nose. Taste was bitter with coffee and hardly any chocolate. The bitterness continued to the end. I must say I was disappointed with his beer and was expecting more chocolate.
